Uses of Package
org.apache.taverna.server.master.exceptions

  • Packages that use org.apache.taverna.server.master.exceptions 
    Package Description
    org.apache.taverna.server.master
    The core of the implementation of Taverna Server, including the implementations of the SOAP and REST interfaces.
    org.apache.taverna.server.master.exceptions
    This package contains the exceptions/faults thrown by Taverna Server.
    org.apache.taverna.server.master.factories
    These interfaces define the principal way for the factories of worker classes to be invoked.
    org.apache.taverna.server.master.interaction
    This package contains the Atom feed implementation for interactions for a particular workflow run.
    org.apache.taverna.server.master.interfaces
    Interfaces to the main worker classes that provide the magical power that drives the webapp front-end.
    org.apache.taverna.server.master.localworker
    Implementation of a Taverna Server back-end that works by forking off workflow executors on the local system.
    org.apache.taverna.server.master.rest
    This package contains the RESTful interface to Taverna Server.
    org.apache.taverna.server.master.rest.handler
    This package contains type handlers for the RESTful interface to Taverna Server.
    org.apache.taverna.server.master.soap
    This package contains the SOAP interface to Taverna Server.
    org.apache.taverna.server.master.utils
    Miscellaneous utility classes.
    org.apache.taverna.server.master.worker
    A Taverna Server back-end that works by forking off workflow executors.
  • Classes in org.apache.taverna.server.master.exceptions used by org.apache.taverna.server.master 
    Class and Description
    BadPropertyValueException
    Indicates a bad property value.
    BadStateChangeException
    Exception that is thrown to indicate that the state change requested for a run is impossible.
    FilesystemAccessException
    An exception that happened when the underlying filesystem was accessed.
    InvalidCredentialException
    An exception that is thrown to indicate that a credential-descriptor or trust-descriptor supplied as part of a credential or trust management operation is invalid.
    NoCreateException
    Exception that is thrown to indicate that the user is not permitted to create something.
    NoCredentialException
    Exception that indicates the absence of an expected credential.
    NoDestroyException
    Exception that is thrown to indicate that the user is not permitted to destroy something.
    NoDirectoryEntryException
    Indicates that the file or directory name was not recognized.
    NoListenerException
    Exception thrown to indicate that no listener by that name exists, or that some other problem with listeners has occurred.
    NotOwnerException
    An exception thrown when an operation is attempted which only the owner is permitted to do.
    NoUpdateException
    Exception that is thrown to indicate that the user is not permitted to update something.
    UnknownRunException
    Exception thrown to indicate that the handle of the run is unknown (or unacceptable to the current user).
  • Classes in org.apache.taverna.server.master.exceptions used by org.apache.taverna.server.master.exceptions 
    Class and Description
    BadStateChangeException
    Exception that is thrown to indicate that the state change requested for a run is impossible.
    NoListenerException
    Exception thrown to indicate that no listener by that name exists, or that some other problem with listeners has occurred.
    NoUpdateException
    Exception that is thrown to indicate that the user is not permitted to update something.

    Class and Description
    BadInputPortNameException
    Indicates that the port name was not recognized.
    BadPropertyValueException
    Indicates a bad property value.
    BadStateChangeException
    Exception that is thrown to indicate that the state change requested for a run is impossible.
    FilesystemAccessException
    An exception that happened when the underlying filesystem was accessed.
    GeneralFailureException
    Some sort of exception that occurred which we can't map any other way.
    InvalidCredentialException
    An exception that is thrown to indicate that a credential-descriptor or trust-descriptor supplied as part of a credential or trust management operation is invalid.
    NoCreateException
    Exception that is thrown to indicate that the user is not permitted to create something.
    NoCredentialException
    Exception that indicates the absence of an expected credential.

    Exception that is thrown to indicate that the user is not permitted to destroy something.

    Indicates that the file or directory name was not recognized.

    Exception thrown to indicate that no listener by that name exists, or that some other problem with listeners has occurred.
    NotOwnerException
    An exception thrown when an operation is attempted which only the owner is permitted to do.
    NoUpdateException
    Exception that is thrown to indicate that the user is not permitted to update something.
    OverloadedException
    Exception that is thrown to indicate that the state change requested for a run is currently impossible due to excessive server load.
    UnknownRunException
    Exception thrown to indicate that the handle of the run is unknown (or unacceptable to the current user).
